summary: Nearly 7 million children between the ages of 3 and 21 received special education services during the 2015-16 school year under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. That's about 13% of the total number of students enrolled in public school. But the percent of the population served under the act varies across states. We found that differences in states' eligibility criteria may contribute to this...
title: Special Education: Varied State Criteria May Contribute to Differences in Percentages of Children Served
